text: Richard Osbaldeston (1691–1764) was a Church of England clergyman and Bishop of London from 1762 to 1764. ==Life== He was born at Hunmanby in Yorkshire, a younger son of Sir Richard Osbaldeston, a prominent landowner and Member of Parliament, head of the Yorkshire branch of an old Lancashire family. His mother, who died young, was Elizabeth Fountayne of Melton. His grandfather William was also a Member of Parliament and his great-grandfather Richard Osbaldeston had been Attorney General for Ireland. He graduated MA from St John's College, Cambridge, in 1714, becoming a Fellow of Peterhouse, Cambridge. He was a chaplain to George II of England, and tutor to George III of England. He became Bishop of Carlisle in 1747. He was a patron of John Jortin.Concise Dictionary of National Biography ==Notes== ==External links== *Material relating to Bishop Osbaldeston at Lambeth Palace LIbrary Category:1691 births Category:1764 deaths Category:Alumni of St John's College, Cambridge Category:Bishops of Carlisle Category:Bishops of London Category:Deans of the Chapel Royal Category:Deans of York Category:18th- century Anglican bishops Category:Fellows of Peterhouse, Cambridge Category:Honorary Chaplains to the Queen Category:People from Hunmanby
title: Richard Osbaldeston
